title: Angelina Jolie's intense Maleficent costume is an occupational hazard
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Angelina Jolie’s Maleficent costume seems like an occupational health and safety hazard.

The star revealed one day we may see some alternative Maleficent costumes that involved goat eyes and feathered hair, and it’s a real trip.

Cover us in horns and paint us officially intrigued.

The actress was in London Wednesday night to premiere her latest Disney film, Mistress Of Evil, and spoke to Metro.co.uk about the lengths she goes to in order to portray the fairy.

Advertisement

With her intimidating garb involving twisting, black horns, jutting cheek prosthetics and a pair of barbed wings, it’s no small feat to play the main character.

Now she’s taking on the role for a second time, five years after the original was released, Angelina, 44, admitted she’s got the prep down to a fine art.

Ange was joined by her children on the red carpet in London (Picture: Doug Peters/EMPICS Entertainment)

‘It takes an hour-and-a-half, less than two hours, to put it all together,’ she told us on the red carpet at BFI Imax.

‘It’s the construction of getting the hair wrapped in the horns, and the cheekbones on. They’re [the makeup team] amazing.’

Asked whether it gets any easier donning such an intense costume, in which she has to spend hours sitting around a set in, Ange was honest in admitting she’s used to the alter-ego now.

See, intense (Picture: Disney)

Those cheeks (Picture: Disney)

‘It just feels…familiar. I think the first time I felt so strange being her, I was always knocking into my trailer door with the horns and everything,’ Angelina laughed.

‘With the first movie we didn’t know if it would work, we didn’t know if people would find it really creepy and strange.

‘It wasn’t just that I had to look like her, I had to look like her and do very emotional scenes. So, would that work? We weren’t sure.’

Angelina, who was joined by her children Zahara, 14, Shiloh, 13, and twins Vivienne and Knox, 11, at last night’s event added: ‘We did lots of tests of different looks for her. Which one day we should release.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I had feather hair, I tried goat eyes. We tried a few things…as you do.’

After first donning the evil fairy’s horns in 2014, this time will be fighting for the love of Princess Aurora (Elle Fanning).

The villain is set to meet her match in the form of Queen Ingrith (Michelle Pfeiffer) who causes drama of explosive proportions when her son Prince Phillip (Harris Dickinson) proposes to Aurora.

Maleficent: Mistress Of Evil is in cinemas 18 October.
